bug.author: Sangboom
bug.summary: [rllilb] No module named 'ray.rllib.models.torch.modules.reshape' Error when I try to import 'DREAMERTrainer'
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
Ray version: 1.1.0 Python version: 3.8.5 OS: Ubuntu 20.04 I have a problem with importing DREAMERTrainer. It says there is no module named Reshape on 'ray.rllib.models.torch.modules.reshape'. So I try to find the Reshape function, and I found that one on 'ray.rllib.models.torch.misc'. Thus, I change 'ray.rllib.models.torch.modules.reshape' into 'ray.rllib.models.torch.misc'. However, it still didn't work (problem on torch_policy.py). In addition, Dreamer works properly on ray 1.0.0 which has 'Reshape' function on the dreamer_model python file. But it didn't work well when I include the same Reshape function on ray 1.1.0's dreamer_model. Thank you <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
I've tried this on the new Anaconda environment just install ray and python only (+ other things that ray needs). Python 3.8.5 (default, Sep 4 2020, 07:30:14) [GCC 7.3.0] :: Anaconda, Inc. on linux Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
from ray.rllib.agents.dreamer import DREAMERTrainer Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/home/sangbeom/anaconda3/envs/dreamerTest/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ray/rllib/agents/dreamer/init.py", line 1, in from ray.rllib.agents.dreamer.dreamer import DREAMERTrainer, DEFAULT_CONFIG File "/home/sangbeom/anaconda3/envs/dreamerTest/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ray/rllib/agents/dreamer/dreamer.py", line 14, in from ray.rllib.agents.dreamer.dreamer_model import DreamerModel File "/home/sangbeom/anaconda3/envs/dreamerTest/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ray/rllib/agents/dreamer/dreamer_model.py", line 3, in from ray.rllib.models.torch.modules.reshape import Reshape ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'ray.rllib.models.torch.modules.reshape'

comments.comment: Thanks for filing this. This is indeed broken. We should also add a simple "compilation" test case, so something like this cannot happen anymore in the future. This issue has been fixed in master now.
